comments:
When opening our overly complicated build files I get the stack traces shown below.

The first trace always seems to happen, but doesn't seem to cause any problems.

The second trace below only occurs when I have a DTD declaration like below, and
and causes (?) the outline view not to have any info in it (i.e. if I remove the
dtd part - 'PUBLIC "-//ANT//DTD project//EN" "file:../../Build/ant/ant.dtd"' - I
do get a populated outline view)

<!DOCTYPE project PUBLIC "-//ANT//DTD project//EN" "file:../../Build/ant/ant.dtd" [
   <!ENTITY build-driver SYSTEM "file:../../Build/ant/build-driver.xml">
   <!ENTITY build-defaults SYSTEM "file:../../Build/ant/build-defaults.xml">
]>

I seem to have a mental block against including the eclipse version in the main
comment, so here it is:  2.1RC1 (200302211557)

=)
I can't reproduce if I point to the ant dtd provided with Eclipse (in the 
source for org.eclipse.ui.externaltools/Ant Editor).  Is it possible to provide 
the dtd?

As well I can't get the first stack trace...do you have any pointers for 
getting this one?

Thanks
Well, NEITHER exception occurs when I run eclipse using a 1.4.1 JDK.  However,
when I run using JDK 1.3.1_04, I get both exceptions (using your dtd from "Ant
Editor")

I've attached a simple project containing the needed files from our build
framework (but your ant.dtd) in which you can duplicate this problem by opening
build.xml

Note that you won't be able to run the build as you'll be missing all the
support classes/files/etc

Created an attachment (id=3703)
Sample project demonstarting bug
Thanks for the project and for the JDK data...I usually run on 1.4.1. I can 
reproduce the problem on IBM 1.3.1 as well.

Christof, can you provide any insight here?
The first stack trace seems to trigger because we get start/endEntity() calls
for entities in the external dtd subset. A way arround this might be to
implement start/endDTD(), setting a flag between these two calls and ignoring
the start/endEntity() calls when the flag is set.
The mystery to me is why the differences between the JDKs..it works fine on 
1.4.1.
With 1.3.1 start/endEntity are called for parameter entities, with 1.4.1 they
aren't. This is acctually documented for LexicalHandler#startEntity which
OutlinePreparingHandler implements ("The reporting of parameter entities [...]
is optional [...]."). I wasn't aware of this. The proposed solution (comment #6)
should fix this.

The second exception is due to the handling in OutlinePreparingHandler getting
out of sync with these additional parameter entities being reported (the
stacktrace is from a SAXException which contains a EmptyStackException
originating from OutlinePreparingHandler#startElement).
Created an attachment (id=3774)
Solved this problem for me on 1.3.1_01
There is more to the issue 1.3 vs. 1.4. With 1.3.1_01 the locator returns the
position in the _external_ file for external entities and
computeStart/EndLocation will fail...
The differences are due to the usage of JAXP, which is shipped with the JRE.
Switching to the Xerces sax parser gives the same behaviour as with JAXP in 1.3.1.
Created an attachment (id=3785)
Switches to the xerces sax parser (experimental)

Attached in case it is of interrest.
Created an attachment (id=3787)
Handles jdk1.3 JAXP Locator behaviour for external entities.

Should work with the Xerces sax parser too.
Have applied and released the patch to use the xerces sax parser.
Have not applied patch from attachment 3787..I thought this would no longer be 
needed but I still get the BadLocationException out of endEntity for the 
orginal test case.
The two patches are complementary. Xerces has the same behaviour (w.r.t. to this
PR) as the JAXP implementation in 1.3.1.
Created an attachment (id=3813)
Updated patch.

Not well tested yet.
Created an attachment (id=3814)
Shows additional problems with the creation of entitiy nodes.
Please verify with the changes to OutlinePreparingHandler, Luc.
Verified.
Please update the build notes (DarinS).
